If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.4-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @marufsharifi **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [expensify_open_source](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1768815970802929) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Use medium font size in your Android 1. Navigate to the App 2. Tap the + button to create a new expense In the this step, view the "Manual" and "Scan" tabs at the top. ## Expected Result: Manual and Scan tab buttons are obvious with no clipping. ## Actual Result: The bottom 10–20% of the Manual/Scan buttons are clipped and not visible. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c3ad3418-5a53-41b0-ba94-6c4466974cbd https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e10bd698-c70e-4967-b13b-b2975f31c9ce [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
## Overview Fix the three issues needed for the Language picker/dropdown on the Sign in screen. Ideally creating a single PR ### Context Part of the accessibility improvement effort tracked in https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/575078 ### Issues to Fix - [ ] #77534 - Screen Reader: Sign in: The button to dismiss the picker view is not announced - [ ] #77541 - Screen Reader: Sign in: Incorrect announcement of the 'Language' dropdown - [ ] #77546 - Screen Reader: Sign in: The button in the picker view is announced without a button role ## Summary of Issues All three issues relate to WCAG 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value compliance for the Language picker component: ## Instructions **Suggested Fixes:** None > **Note:** Discuss on Slack if you are unsure whether a sub-issue should be fixed or if you are unsure about the right fix / expected result. Ideally, create a single PR that will fix all the issues listed to minimize review time (more PRs only if necessary).

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.4-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79437 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+dp501@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** iPhone 12 / iOS 18.7 **App Component:** Left Hand Navigation (LHN) ## Action Performed: Preconditions 1. Account A has: a default workspace and another workspace with a bank account added 2. Account B: Currency preference is set to USD, sends an IOU to Account A Steps: 1. Launch the app as Account A. 2. Open the IOU from Account B. 3. Tap the Pay dropdown. 4. Select the workspace that has a bank account added. 5. Navigate back to the 1:1 chat with Account B. 6. Go offline ## Expected Result: The system message “moved this expense” remains not greyed out after going offline. ## Actual Result: The system message “moved this expense” becomes greyed out once the user goes offline. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3253499f-14c7-4f0b-8ee2-c22e75f311c6 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.4-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3029/folder/13176791/41237172/1131713297 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck11626100@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** iPhone 16/18.7.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch Hybrid app 2. Submit manual expense in workspace chat 3. Navigate to expense details 4. Tap More >> Split 5. Click "Add split" button to add two or more splits 6. For each split, edit the amount 7. Select either 1st, 2nd or 3rd split 8. Tap category field 9. Do not dismiss the device keypad 10. Select any category displayed above the keypad or search for any other category and select it 11. Tap Save button ## Expected Result: Save button in Split page should shift to the bottom when saving category for split amount. No blank space appears below Save button ## Actual Result: Save button shifts above to center of Split page while saving category for one of the split amount & creates a blank space below Save button ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/11a018ab-59e4-4a88-9d3f-a88498ab5b0c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.4-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3028/folder/13176872/41237335/1131712388 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjojsinjdosdjnojsdios@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two expenses. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Open any expense. 6. Click Hold > More. 7. Enter reason and save it. 8. Close the report RHP. 9. On the expense report RHP, click Submit. 10. Click Approve. → Pop-up modal shows pending (unheld) amount and total amount - Expected. 11. Return to main workspace chat. 12. Click Approve on the expense preview. ## Expected Result: Pop-up modal will show pending amount and total amount when approving from the expense preview. ## Actual Result: Pop-up modal only shows total amount when approving from the expense preview. Pending amount is missing. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91dff94a-a813-4296-b4da-23e6f4157bd7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
